summary: This document is the curriculum vitae of Dr. Ryan C. W. Hall, a forensic psychiatrist based in Florida. It details his extensive education, professional positions, certifications, publications, presentations, and media appearances. The CV shows a highly credentialed expert in forensic psychiatry with a focus on topics like PTSD, violence, pedophilia, and legal competency, but contains no direct references to Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, or his case.

persons.name: Ryan Chaloner Winton Hall
persons.context: The subject of the curriculum vitae; a forensic psychiatrist with academic appointments, extensive publications, and professional leadership roles.

persons.name: Richard C. W. Hall
persons.context: Co-author on numerous publications with Ryan C. W. Hall; listed as the name of Ryan Hall's professional association from 2008-2017.

persons.name: Yossef S. Ben-Porath
persons.context: Led MMPI-2-RF training webinars that Dr. Hall attended, as listed under 'Additional Training'.

persons.name: C. Scott
persons.context: Co-presenter of a 2014 AAPL course on 'Evaluation of Malingered Psychosis' that Dr. Hall attended.

persons.name: B. McDermott
persons.context: Co-presenter of AAPL courses on malingering and amnesia that Dr. Hall attended in 2014 and 2015.

persons.name: Timothy R. Day
persons.context: Co-author with Dr. Hall on law review articles and book chapters, and co-presenter at conferences on topics like video game violence and healthcare law.

persons.name: Susan Hatters Friedman
persons.context: Frequent co-author with Dr. Hall on publications and newsletters, and co-presenter at numerous conferences on topics like pregnancy, malpractice, and pop culture in psychiatry.

persons.name: William C. Myers
persons.context: Co-author with Dr. Hall on research related to malingering in homicide defendants and ADHD in incarcerated populations.

persons.name: Benjamin Kramer
persons.context: Delegate for whom Dr. Hall provided written testimony on elder abuse bills in 2008.

persons.name: Robert Wesley
persons.context: Public Defender for the 9th Judicial Circuit in Florida who hosted training events where Dr. Hall presented on sanity and mental health.

connections.description: Extensive co-authorship on dozens of academic publications spanning many years, suggesting a close professional and likely familial relationship.
Frequent co-authors on publications and newsletters, and regular co-presenters at national conferences, indicating a strong collaborative partnership.
Co-authorship on legal-academic works and joint presentations, indicating a collaboration bridging psychiatry and law.
Dr. Hall provided expert written testimony to Delegate Kramer for Maryland legislation on elder abuse.

events.title: Testimony on Elder Abuse
events.description: Dr. Hall provided written testimony on elder abuse in support of Maryland bills HE1873/SB501, presented to the Maryland House Judiciary Committee.

events.title: Testimony on Mental Health Parity
events.description: Dr. Hall testified before the Florida Senate Banking and Insurance Committee on SB 354 regarding Mental Health Parity.

events.title: AMA House of Delegates Participation
events.description: Dr. Hall served as the American Academy of Psychiatry and the Law's Young Physician Delegate to the American Medical Association's House of Delegates meetings.

events.title: COVID-19 Response Participation
events.description: Dr. Hall participated in Florida's Coronavirus Rehabilitative Services Working Group and a COVID-19 Virtual Town Hall.

locations: 2500 West Lake Mary Blvd; Ste 219 Lake Mary, FL 32746
keyFacts: This document is solely the professional CV of Dr. Ryan C. W. Hall and contains no mention of Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, or any known victims or associates from the Epstein case.
Dr. Hall is a highly credentialed forensic psychiatrist with expertise in areas relevant to criminal cases, including PTSD, malingering, pedophilia, competency, and violence risk assessment.
His CV shows extensive media interaction, including commentary on high-profile cases like Casey Anthony and Jerry Sandusky, and topics like Ebola and video game violence.
The document establishes Dr. Hall as a potential expert witness in legal proceedings, given his forensic certifications, publication record, and presentation history.
The CV was updated on October 11, 2021, placing it chronologically after the major developments in the Epstein case.
